text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
BeScoreResult 0..*ResourceThe score result
identifier 0..*IdentifierThe business identifier(s) for this score result
subject 1..1Reference(BePatient)The person for which the score has been assessed
category 0..1CodeableConceptThe score category
bodySite 0..1CodeableConceptThe body site that the score refers to. Includes laterality
code 1..1CodeableConceptThe score that has been calculated
Binding: Score Value Set (required)
period 1..1PeriodThe date or time interval that the score refers to.
recordedDate 1..1dateTimeThe date when the score is being recorded or updated
value[x] 1..1The result of the score - the actual score of the patient
valueCodeableConceptCodeableConcept
valueQuantityQuantity
valueRatioRatio
valueBooleanboolean
valueStringstring
interpretation 0..1CodeableConceptWhat the score means or implies, e.g. 'high risk, must follow up'.
referenceRange 0..*BackboneElementThe reference evaluation ranges for the score, e.g. '1 to 2 = low risk', etc.
range 0..1RangeThe range of values for the score
meaning 0..1CodeableConceptThe reference meaning or interpretation for the range
derivedFrom 0..*Reference()The data source that this result derives from, e.g. a response to a questionnaire, or a clinical document.. '.

Documentation for this format

name: BeScoreResult
description: This is the logical model of a Score Result, the result of a scoring assessment by a person or a system. Examples are risk scores, or pain score...

element.short: The score result
element.definition: A record of a calculated or determined score.

element.short: Logical id of this artifact
element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

element.short: Metadata about the resource
element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
element.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies it's meaning or interpretation

element.short: Language of the resource content
element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The business identifier(s) for this score result
element.definition: The business identifier(s) for this score result - This is an optional attribute, used for example to track a score result throughout its lifecycle, or across vaults.

element.short: The person for which the score has been assessed
element.definition: The patient

element.short: The score category
element.definition: Here the grouping of score categories - for example 'Pain' or 'Risk'. The actual score code is in the attribute 'code'. This is a grouping or categorization.

element.short: The body site that the score refers to. Includes laterality
element.definition: The body site that the score refers to. Includes laterality.

element.short: The score that has been calculated
element.definition: This is code for the score (e.g. DOLOPLUS, FINDRISC, APGAR)

element.short: The date or time interval that the score refers to.
element.definition: The date or time interval that the score refers to.

element.short: The date when the score is being recorded or updated
element.definition: The date when the score is being recorded or updated

element.short: The result of the score - the actual score of the patient
element.definition: The result of the score - the actual score of the patient , e.g. '10' or 'high risk'

element.short: What the score means or implies, e.g. 'high risk, must follow up'.
element.definition: What the score means or implies, e.g. 'high risk, must follow up'.

element.short: The reference evaluation ranges for the score, e.g. '1 to 2 = low risk', etc.
element.definition: The reference evaluation ranges for the score, e.g. '1 to 2 = low risk', etc.

element.short: The range of values for the score
element.definition: The range of values for the score

element.short: The reference meaning or interpretation for the range
element.definition: The reference meaning or interpretation for the range

element.short: The data source that this result derives from, e.g. a response to a questionnaire, or a clinical document.. '.
element.definition: The data source that this result derives from, e.g. a response to a questionnaire, or a clinical document.. '.
